title.narrative: OP 1.4:LEARNING AND REDUCTION OF DROPOUT

description.narrative: Innovative and relevant learning pathways and programmes aiming at improvement learning and reduction of dropout in secondary school designed and validated., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 all children with a focus on the most disadvantaged, are reached by effective public policies and programmes in health, education, and social protection

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Innovative and relevant learning pathways and programmes aiming at improvement learning and reduction of dropout in secondaryschool designed and validated.

description.narrative: In 2020, UNICEF generated knowledge and coordinated activities focused on preventing school dropout and improving secondary education completion rates. In addition to this strategy, UNICEF supported several strategies to promote educational continuity in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic and the consequent school closures. These included an innovative pilot initiative combining monetary transfers and tailored student support that will be evaluated in partnership with the IDB. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:13/01/2021
